result.execSummary:
The defendant Kelly J. Watkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent to 15CF546 & 15CF675.
Credit for 210 days, if revoked.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Counseling shall specifically include:  DV Counseling.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not have contact with Carrie L, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

records.addlTxt: FROM 15CF546  JK/MG
of disposition of case; deft released from custody as to this file only.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney D Henderson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Statement from Carrie L.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 3 years w/conditions, concurrent to 15CF546 & 15CF675; 1 year conditional jail is stayed w/Huber privileges; credit for 210 days served if revoked; deft to pay $250 DNA surcharge; bond applied to costs from files 15CF546, 15CF304, 15CF675; no contact with Carrie L.
With Atty Henderson the SEH of 3/7/16 at 1:30pm is rescheduled, due to a conflict w/the court's calendar; reset to 3/28/16 at 2:30pm.
from deft.
from DE to Judge.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney D Henderson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, cts 1, 3-6 are dismissed and read in.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 3/7/16 at 1:30pm.  Bond continued.
State's notice regarding deft's statements; filed by ADA Jennifer Phan.
to consolidate cases for trial; filed by ADA Jennifer Phan.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney D Henderson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Henderson reports that the State made a modified offer, deft does not wish to accept the offer.  Case 15CF546 to proceed first to trial on 1/25/16 at 8:30am.  ADA Phan states she intends to file motion to consolidate this case with 15CF675 & 15CF546.  ond continued.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Atty D Henderson appeared on behalf of deft.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft in custody, was brought over at time of hearing but Atty Henderson was in another branch and deft was returned to jail prior to case being called.  Case is not resolved.  JSH 1/7/16 at 1:15pm and JS 1/25/16 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.
on behalf of deft jh

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney D Henderson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  ADA Phan states there is a global offer the deft needs to consider.  STC continued to 10/15/15 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.
Preliminary Hearing Waiver/Plea Offer
to Preliminary Hearing

Defendant, Kelly J. Watkins, appeared with Attorney Douglas I. Henderson.  Attorney Andrew Joseph Burgoyne appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: Victim rights compliance. DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over to Br 6.  Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued. Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 09:00 am.
